who_we_are.left_column: A high-quality photo of the ministry building or an official event
who_we_are.right_column_text: The Imo State Ministry of Finance is the backbone of the state's financial system. It is responsible for the efficient planning, coordination, and control of all financial matters of the state government. The ministry ensures accountability, transparency, and optimal use of resources in support of economic growth and development in Imo State.
who_we_are.cta_button: Our Departments → leads to a detailed page about key departments and units

structure: Directors of Units and Departments (Budget, Treasury, Internal Revenue, etc.)

how_we_operate.description: The Ministry operates through specialized departments and units that handle budgeting, treasury management, economic planning, internal revenue generation, procurement oversight, donor coordination, and fiscal policy development. Each unit plays a critical role in ensuring that the financial systems of Imo State remain responsive, transparent, and effective.

content.mission_statement: To manage the financial resources of Imo State with transparency, integrity, and efficiency, in order to promote sustainable development, improve service delivery, and enhance the standard of living of Imo citizens.
content.vision_statement: To become a model public finance institution delivering accountable and innovative financial services that support inclusive economic growth and development in Imo State.

core_values.transparency: Upholding openness in all financial dealings
core_values.accountability: Answering for the proper use of state funds
core_values.integrity: Doing the right thing, even when no one is watching
core_values.professionalism: Maintaining high standards and ethics in service
core_values.innovation: Seeking new ways to improve financial systems and service delivery
core_values.people_centeredness: Making finance work for the benefit of all Imo citizens

commissioner_profile.photo: A professional portrait of Hon. Chuk Chukwuemeka
commissioner_profile.bio: Hon. Chuk Chukwuemeka, with over two decades of experience in public financial management, previously served as Director of Public Procurement and Economic Adviser under Governor Ikedi Ohakim's administration. He currently serves as Commissioner for Finance under Governor Hope Uzodimma, where he leads the charge for economic reform, fiscal responsibility, and improved financial governance.

content.display_format: clickable cards for each department or agency, each with a 'Learn More' button to access detailed information

department_of_expenditure.name: Department of Expenditure
functions: Oversees and controls public spending in accordance with the approved budget
Ensures timely and efficient release of funds to ministries, departments, and agencies (MDAs)
Monitors financial commitments and expenditure trends to maintain fiscal discipline

department_of_financial_services.name: Department of Financial Services
functions: Manages financial instruments, state investments, and debt servicing
Oversees state loans, grants, and financial agreements with domestic and international bodies
Ensures optimal use of financial resources and services

department_of_budget.name: Department of Budget
functions: Prepares and coordinates the state's annual budget
Aligns budget proposals with government priorities and economic policies
Monitors and evaluates budget implementation and performance

department_of_accounts.name: Department of Accounts
functions: Maintains accurate financial records of all government transactions
Prepares financial statements, payment vouchers, and reports
Ensures adherence to financial regulations and accounting standards

department_of_economic_research.name: Department of Economic Research and Policy Management
functions: Conducts economic research to inform fiscal and financial policies
Analyzes trends, forecasts, and indicators to guide planning
Advises on strategies for economic growth and development

department_of_internal_audit.name: Department of Internal Audit
functions: Carries out internal audits to ensure compliance and financial integrity
Identifies risks, irregularities, and areas for improvement
Recommends corrective measures and ensures accountability

department_of_procurement.name: Department of Procurement
functions: Oversees transparent and efficient procurement processes for goods and services
Ensures compliance with procurement laws and guidelines
Maintains a database of vendors and contracts

department_of_hr.name: Department of Human Resources Management
functions: Manages staff recruitment, training, promotions, and welfare
Ensures effective human resource planning and development
Oversees performance management and capacity building

department_of_ict.name: Department of Information, Communication and Technology (ICT)
functions: Supports digital transformation of financial operations and reporting
Maintains IT infrastructure and secure data systems
Facilitates automation and e-governance within the ministry

legal_unit.name: Legal Unit
functions: Provides legal advice on financial policies, contracts, and agreements
Drafts and reviews legal documents and memoranda of understanding
Represents the ministry in legal matters and ensures compliance with laws and regulations

agencies: Imo State Board of Internal Revenue (IIRS)

content.overview: Welcome to our Projects Hub, where you can explore key government initiatives aimed at driving economic prosperity, enhancing infrastructure, and improving livelihoods across Imo State. Each project reflects our commitment to transparency, impact, and inclusive growth.
content.display_format: Project Cards Section (Visual Layout) - Each project appears as a card with: A title, A short teaser description, A 'Learn More' button leading to the full project details

affordable_housing.title: Affordable Housing Initiative
affordable_housing.teaser: Building modern, cost-effective housing for Imo families.
affordable_housing.description: We are expanding access to safe, affordable homes through strategic public-private partnerships. These projects reduce housing deficits while creating construction jobs across local communities.

economic_diversification.title: Economic Diversification & Infrastructure Development
economic_diversification.teaser: Reducing dependence on oil, strengthening our economy.
economic_diversification.description: This project supports investments in agriculture, energy, ICT, and logistics infrastructure across Imo. Our goal is to lay the foundation for sustainable development and generate new streams of revenue.

msmes_support.title: MSMEs Growth & Empowerment Program
msmes_support.teaser: Fueling the heart of our economy—small businesses.
msmes_support.description: We provide funding, mentorship, and digital tools to empower micro, small, and medium-scale enterprises. This initiative supports job creation, innovation, and financial inclusion across all LGAs in Imo State.

content.closing_statement: Through these projects, the Imo State Ministry of Finance and Economic Development is unlocking opportunities, solving real challenges, and building a more resilient future for every Imolite.
